def: A race run by young men with lighted torches in their hands. Hewho reached the goal first, with his torch unextinguished, gained theprize.
A picture representing or symbolizing the early infancy ofChrist. The simplest form is the babe in a rude cradle, and the headsof an ox and an ass to express the stable in which he was born.
One who, or that which, quenches. Hammond.
In a desperate manner; without regard to danger or safety;recklessly; extremely; as, the troops fought desperately.She fell desperately in love with him. Addison.
A hint, suggestion, token, or memorial, to awaken memory; thatwhich reminds or recalls to memory; a souvenir.Seasonable mementos may be useful. Bacon.
A lighter, or vessel for inland navigation. [Scot.] Jamieson.
The small aperture or foremen in the outer coat of the ovule ofa plant.

The principal or most important spring in a piece of mechanism,especially the moving spring of a watch or clock or the spring in agunlock which impels the hammer. Hence: The chief or most powerfulmotive; the efficient cause of action.
The ninth month of the year, containing thurty days.
Having the form of an egg; having a figure such that anysection in the direction of the shorter diameter will be circular,and any in the direction of the longer diameter will be oval.
